snippet: Labor is vital to the chances of Jesus G. Garcia in Tuesday’s runoff. But Mayor Rahm Emanuel is receiving a surprisingly solid amount of union support.
abstract: Series of legal decisions and number of anti-corruption investigations have upended electoral landscape in Chicago by dismantling Democratic political machine that dominated elections for decades; change explains in part Mayor Rahm Emanuel's difficult re-election campaign, and accounts for large role organized labor has played in election, particularly in way Chicago Teachers Union has backed Emanuel's rival Jesus G Garcia.
lead_paragraph: Labor is vital to the chances of Jesus G. Garcia in Tuesday’s runoff. But Mayor Rahm Emanuel is receiving a surprisingly solid amount of union support.

headline.main: In Chicago’s Reshaped Politics, Unions Are Divided Over Mayoral Race
headline.print_headline: In Chicago’s Reshaped Politics, Unions Are Divided Over Mayoral Race
